rxf.server

Class Rfc822HeaderState

  • java.lang.Object
    • rxf.server.Rfc822HeaderState
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    Rfc822HeaderState.HttpRequest, Rfc822HeaderState.HttpResponse

    public class Rfc822HeaderState
extends Object
    this is a utility class to parse a HttpRequest header or $res header according to declared need of header/cookies downstream.

    much of what is in BlobAntiPatternObject can be teased into this class peicemeal.

    since java string parsing can be expensive and addHeaderInterest can be numerous this class is designed to parse only what is necessary or typical and enable slower dynamic grep operations to suit against a captured ByteBuffer as needed (still cheap)

    preload addHeaderInterest and cookies, send $res and HttpRequest initial onRead for .apply()

    User: jim Date: 5/19/12 Time: 10:00 PM

      • sourceKey

        public Rfc822HeaderState sourceKey(SelectionKey key)
                            throws IOException
        assigns a state parser to a SelectionKey and attempts to grab the source route froom the active socket.

        this is necessary to look up GeoIpService queries among other things

        Parameters:
        key - a NIO select key
        Returns:
        self
        Throws:
        IOException

      • headerBuf

        public ByteBuffer headerBuf()
        the actual ByteBuffer associated with the state.

        this buffer must start at position 0 in most cases requiring ReadableByteChannel.read(ByteBuffer)

        Returns:
        what is sent to apply(ByteBuffer)

      • getHeaderStrings

        public Map<String,String> getHeaderStrings()
        header values which are pre-parsed during apply(ByteBuffer).

        addHeaderInterest in the HttpRequest/HttpResponse not so named in this list will be passed over.

        the value of a header appearing more than once is unspecified.

        multiple occuring addHeaderInterest require getHeadersNamed(String)

        Returns:
        the parsed values designated by the headerInterest list of keys. addHeaderInterest present in headerInterest not appearing in the ByteBuffer input will not be in this map.

      • cookies

        public Rfc822HeaderState cookies(String... cookies)
        fluent setter
        Parameters:
        cookies - a list of cookies registered to be auto-parsed
        Returns:
        self

      • apply

        public Rfc822HeaderState apply(ByteBuffer cursor)
        direction-agnostic RFC822 header state is mapped from a ByteBuffer with tolerance for HTTP method and results in the first line.

        headerInterest contains a list of addHeaderInterest that will be converted to a Map and available via getHeaderStrings()

        cookies contains a list of cookies from which to parse from Cookie header into cookieStrings

        setting cookies for a HttpResponse header is possible by setting dirty to true and setting cookieStrings map values.

        currently this is done inside of ProtocolMethodDispatch surrounding SimpleRequestProcessor.process(String)

        Parameters:
        cursor -
        Returns:
        this

      • headerInterest

        public Rfc822HeaderState headerInterest(one.xio.HttpHeaders... replaceInterest)

      • addHeaderInterest

        public Rfc822HeaderState addHeaderInterest(String... newInterest)
        Appends to the Set of header keys this parser is interested in mapping to strings.

        these addHeaderInterest are mapped at cardinality<=1 when apply(ByteBuffer) }is called.

        for cardinality=>1 addHeaderInterest getHeadersNamed(String) is a pure grep over the entire ByteBuffer.

        Parameters:
        newInterest -
        Returns:
        See Also:
        getHeadersNamed(String), apply(ByteBuffer)

        Returns:
        See Also:

      • dirty

        public Rfc822HeaderState dirty(boolean dirty)
        indicate whether or not we want to rewrite the cookies and push SetCookie to client. if this is set, the contents of cookieStrings will be written each as cookies during asResponseHeaderByteBuffer()
        Parameters:
        dirty -
        Returns:

      • headerBuf

        public Rfc822HeaderState headerBuf(ByteBuffer headerBuf)
        this is what has been sent to apply(ByteBuffer).

        care must be taken to avoid ByteBuffer.compact() during the handling of the dst/cursor found in AsioVisitor code if this is sent in without a clean ByteBuffer.

        Parameters:
        headerBuf - an immutable ByteBuffer
        Returns:
        self

      • pathResCode

        public String pathResCode()
        dual purpose HTTP protocol header token found on the first line of a HttpRequest/HttpResponse in the second position contains either the path (HttpRequest) or a the numeric result code on responses. user is responsible for populating this on outbound addHeaderInterest
        Returns:
        See Also:
        pathRescode

      • pathResCode

        Returns:
        See Also:
        pathRescode

      • protocolStatus

        public String protocolStatus()
        Dual purpose HTTP protocol header token found on the first line of a HttpRequest/HttpResponse in the third position.

        Contains either the protocol (HttpRequest) or a status line message (HttpResponse)

      • protocolStatus

      • asResponseHeaderString

        public String asResponseHeaderString()
        writes method, headersStrings, and cookieStrings to a String suitable for Response addHeaderInterest

        populates addHeaderInterest from headerStrings

        if dirty is set this will include SetCookie addHeaderInterest (plural) one for each of cookieStrings()

        Returns:
        http addHeaderInterest for use with http 1.1

        Returns:
        http addHeaderInterest for use with http 1.1
